content: ow manager crane now the complication of the crane looks
a bit difficult but it's really simple it's just some basic wooden bits okay so
the base is just a wooden round with a square piece of wood block on top of it
and then in front of that I have a spindle with a matchstick coming through
it and then I cut off the ends of the matchstick then up from that I have a
craft stick that has the end cut off and on the end of the craft stick I glued a
bamboo cocktail skewer and I cut the points off the end of that so then for
the crank I just use a larger spindle wrapped some hemp twine around it then
glued it to the block covered the hole in the spindle with a coffee store and
there and that's what that is then for the wheel you can get these at the craft
store they have these little wheels and gears and stuff you can buy and I just
use one of those two for the crank itself now here in this next picture you
can see a little nice side view of this the construction also I glued a washer
on the bottom and now give it some nice weight okay and I also used a rhinestone
and cover it up put it on the end of that coffee store stirrer to look like
it's bolted on you know it's bolted on to the spindle so there we go and I used
goop to glue this all together so it's a nice strong glue so after my contraption
dried I black bond it with a flat black spray paint then I hit it with a burnt
umber for a nice dark undercoat then hit it with a medium brown so on top of that
and then to the finishing I put a lighter brown on top of that so then for
the rope itself I just used a tan and I gave a nice rope color to this and for
the wheel on the crane I used a gunmetal as well as a little rhinestone on the
other side that looked like kind of this the rod going through the wheel so there
we go pretty cool now I have one last detail to do on this the final trick was
how do I make a hook for the end of the crane so what I did was I took a small
bead and a paper fast now and I cut the pieces off the
paper fasteners head and then I kind of curled them around an ink pen and that
gave me the hook then I just glued the hook into the small bead with my e6000
or group and then glued that to the end of the crane rope so there we go easy
and cheap solution here we are our minis are loading something somewhere so here
we go a little setup here to show off the crane and here it is it's just
really easy to make just a bunch of pieces just kind of cobble together that
twine just coiled around that spindle and yeah just a few details really make
this look like a nice little crane and that hook on the end was really easy to
do so there you go an easy a super easy way to make a nice little crane for your
games hey mr. handy get out of here this is my
gig what do that oh yeah don't do that Oh
